column1: As Americans we have so much to be thankful for – from our Constitution that protects our liberties to medical science innovations which have contributed to the speedy delivery of COVID-19 vaccines. I am thankful that healthcare workers are risking their lives to save ours.

In-classroom learning is absolutely essential for children.  Isolating students from their support networks is unjustifiable considering the minimal spread of COVID-19 in rural Colorado.  Thanks all for joining me to discuss plans to safely reopen schools. https://t.co/ayHnK7kvE5

This is nothing more than #Russiagate 2.0.   Speaker Pelosi is using USPS conspiracy theories to meddle in the 2020 election.   What happened to providing meaningful COVID-19 relief for struggling Americans? https://t.co/1sQdsqyP4I

Twitter was noticeably absent from last month’s #BigTech hearing.   It's time we hear from @jack on Twitter's blatant censorship of conservative voices and willingness to protect the Chinese Communist Party's outright lies about the spread of coronavirus.  https://t.co/NFpuofZ4KL
I’m joining @foxandfriends at 7:15 MT/9:15 ET to discuss how coronavirus lockdowns are affecting small businesses. Tune in! https://t.co/rXLI9aF9Va

If Democrats keep playing politics with coronavirus spending bills it could be the death knell of our recovery.   Americans are tired of Pelosi and Schumer piling pork into legislation designed to help small businesses and working-class Americans.  https://t.co/wh0R0Xiem3

Today I introduced the No Bailouts for Illegal Aliens Act to ensure taxpayers aren’t bailing out states and localities that are setting up programs to send COVID-19 cash payments to illegal immigrants. https://t.co/X5M1v2JZTp https://t.co/EuFPttlnke

Public officials cannot make the best decisions for their constituents with artificially inflated statistics.    I’m calling on the @CDCgov to issue new guidance to follow Colorado’s lead and ensure official death tallies only include cases that are directly related to COVID-19. https://t.co/yckjhrAXWQ

There should always be an asterisk next to anything that China says. The Chinese Communist Party lied about the spread of the coronavirus and put millions of lives at risk.  We cannot continue to fund the World Health Organization if it continues to parrot CCP talking points. https://t.co/QuSeEFkQHh
Nancy Pelosi’s latest coronavirus bill is essentially one big get-out-of-jail-free card for millions of prisoners regardless of how heinous their crimes were. https://t.co/CyliqKtF9p

Colorado received over 180000 N-95 masks in the month of April as a result of @WhiteHouse and @FEMA efforts.   Thank you @realDonaldTrump for prioritizing the safety of Coloradans affected by COVID-19!

THIS JUST IN: Under recently passed legislation illegal immigrants are currently eligible for COVID-19 benefits.  Now more than ever we need to prioritize Americans and make sure recovery rebates are only available to people who are in the U.S. legally. https://t.co/RBJ0OGAAUc

The WHO must be held accountable for its role in covering up the Chinese Communist Party’s failed response to #COVID_19.   @realDonaldTrump is right to halt funding for this corrupt organization. https://t.co/TsrPztqHbs
I’m hosting a Coronavirus Q&A Telephone Town Hall with community leaders today at 4:00 PM MT for the residents of #CO04.   ☎️ Learn more here: https://t.co/mgDqrKAlTV

Home builders across the country will pause work on Thursday April 16 and "stand down" for education on coronavirus safety on the job site to keep themselves healthy and help #FlattenTheCurve. More information on the #COVID19SafetyStandDown at https://t.co/BceiXVfjOp

☎️ #CO04: Join me for a Q&A with community leaders to discuss resources available to Coloradans as a result of #COVID_19.   Sign up here to receive a call from me on Tuesday April 14 at 4:00 PM MT 👇  https://t.co/gub1RQdx9D https://t.co/lVipnitiXT

I’ve asked the Coronavirus Task Force to provide businesses with industry-specific support and sanitation guidelines to make sure America’s grand reopening is a success. We must do everything we can to help businesses safely and confidently reopen their doors when the time comes. https://t.co/jLJtxyO13A
I’m on air with @randycorporon talking about China's involvement in the coronavirus pandemic.  Tune in to @710KNUS and listen live! https://t.co/HMnpoDWWjM
I joined a bipartisan group of legislators in a letter asking the FCC and DOJ to combat coronavirus-related scammers and protect the safety and welfare of all Americans. https://t.co/xRUh8nyoiS

The Chinese government has covered up its involvement in the coronavirus crisis since the beginning.  It is absolutely necessary that we lead the world community in making sure that China is held accountable in the future. https://t.co/gFp0ILsJ3g

Rural Health Clinics and Critical Access Hospitals are on the frontlines of the #COVID_19 pandemic in #CO04.   @SBAgov must take immediate steps to ensure CAHs and RHCs are eligible for loan programs so they can continue to serve the community and keep fighting the coronavirus. https://t.co/CKfms7wpG8

Great news! #CO04’s own Aytu Bioscience is stepping up to the plate to provide healthcare professionals with #COVID_19 rapid test kits.  My staff and I have been working consistently with the FDA to approve these rapid tests and I’m pleased Aytu can finally get the ball rolling. https://t.co/hX8cmyQoNn

The CCP’s irresponsible handling of the coronavirus and its false propaganda have worsened this global health crisis.  It’s time we as a Congress take a strong stand against China’s nefarious actions.   https://t.co/GxqDGok9iJ
If you or someone you know is stranded abroad due to #COVID_19 please reach out to my office for assistance. https://t.co/GlTtoUxWsm

How can I volunteer to help during the coronavirus crisis?  "What kind of assistance is provided for small businesses?"  "How do I file for unemployment?"  Please use my website as a resource for answers to any questions you may have about #COVID_19 ⤵️ https://t.co/s9yWFL2AC1 https://t.co/w0Fa7UVzEl

Unfortunately the CARES Act will harm our future generations in ways that the coronavirus never could — by drastically increasing our national debt by stuffing this bill with pork.  My full statement: https://t.co/POphGdmNQ3

Still I’m finding policies that are straight off of the Democrats’ wishlist in this “coronavirus response” bill.   Page 628 includes a provision that gives sanctuary cities access to $850000000 in law enforcement grants. https://t.co/VES4XkeXKl

Doomsday-like predictions of #COVID_19 have created unnecessary panic and reactionary policy decisions.   We need to instill confidence in the American people and hyperbolic reports like Mr. Ferguson’s are making matters worse. https://t.co/amrIBDNny6

Funding for “Washington’s Opera House” has no place in a coronavirus response bill.   We need to focus on policy that will instill confidence in the American people and get our economy back up and running. https://t.co/wykYeD0eHb

This “coronavirus response” package has special carveouts of $75M for public broadcasting and $50M for museums/libraries.   That’s $125M for pet projects instead of for struggling families and businesses.   Dems are again exploiting a crisis to fund their liberal wishlist. https://t.co/l7hEaN2c6w

Everyone should read through this thread on just how ridiculous Nancy Pelosi’s "coronavirus response" bill is.   How exactly are carbon emissions requirements for airlines or same-day voter registration supposed to help vulnerable populations during these hard times? https://t.co/IbEAQBZuf6

“We cannot let the cure be worse than the problem itself."   I commend the President’s leadership and appreciate his holistic approach to combating the coronavirus. I stand ready to work with him to make sure all vulnerable groups are taken care of. https://t.co/5J1z9dcRyo

During my interview with @DanCaplis last night I made it clear that the President is acting in a very measured way to reassure Americans and prevent coronavirus panic.  My problem is with the many conflicting rules from different levels of leadership that cause even more panic. https://t.co/0QzFVyGkH8

It’s our responsibility as members of Congress to promote calm and examine the #COVID_19 situation strategically using facts not hyperbole.   We need to instill confidence in the American people and get our economy back up and running. https://t.co/bjQA9MMswA

Our small businesses are facing substantial losses and disruption during these uncertain times.   That’s why I signed onto a letter with the entire Colorado delegation urging @SBAgov to approve our state’s  disaster declaration and help affected businesses recover. #COVIDー19 https://t.co/Prgxv5C2c8

After signing a letter asking the CDC to expedite state grant requests I’m proud to report Colorado has been granted $9M+ for tests and vaccine development.  I support this decisive action to give states exactly what they need to combat the #coronavirus. https://t.co/90otK2aRe6

The President has released updated #COVID_19 information for Americans.   We can all do our part to slow the spread of the coronavirus by following the guidelines below. Learn more by visiting https://t.co/uJ5ca9QSsr. https://t.co/R8jFYJ83zj

📣 #CO04: Please use the @CDCgov as a resource for #COVID_19 updates and safety tips.  As this outbreak continues it’s important not to panic but continue to take commonsense preventive measures to stop the spread of disease. Learn more: https://t.co/uJ5ca9QSsr https://t.co/h1OcRokakO

All sorts of Christmas-tree ornaments were added to this bill. 15% of the funds were to be spent on foreign countries & millions went towards unrelated telehealth funding.  Indiscriminately throwing money at a problem like coronavirus wont make it go away. https://t.co/TedJuvqc1u https://t.co/60MBozVmly

I will be keeping a close watch on the two presumptive positive cases of #COVID19 in Colorado. We can all take proactive steps by reducing contact with people who are sick and staying home when you are feeling sick. Learn more here: https://t.co/QrkxhLCtRv

We’ve known about the severity of the coronavirus for months.  Instead of considering the President’s thoughtful response the Democrats pulled together a bloated spending package overnight.  As always thanks for having me @ContactLenz_KOA and @AprilZesbaugh. https://t.co/NZSNaEiSPC
Since day 1 Democrats have politicized the coronavirus. The president’s initial $2.5 billion request was a thoughtful proposal to address our coronavirus response needs.

We must lay down our partisan swords to respond to the coronavirus and do what’s best for the country.  That’s why I signed a letter urging @SpeakerPelosi and @LeaderHoyer against tying a public health crisis to the upcoming FISA re-authorization. https://t.co/YofHvL2h7a
